subject: biology
title: The Water Cycle Treasure
description: Follow the clue trail to discover how water travels through nature in an endless cycle. Collect three magical clues to unlock the treasure!

clueTrail.title: The Journey Begins - Evaporation
clueTrail.objective: Understand how water transforms from liquid to vapor and rises into the atmosphere
clueTrail.content: When the sun heats up water in rivers, lakes, and oceans, it turns into invisible water vapor that rises up into the sky. This is called evaporation! Just like when you see steam rising from a hot cup of tea, water changes from liquid to gas when it gets warm enough. The warmer it gets, the faster water evaporates.

clue.name: Glowing Water Drop
clue.description: A magical drop of water ascending to the clouds

challengeData.instruction: Drag the sun to shine on the water body and watch evaporation happen!

clueTrail.title: Cloud Formation - Condensation
clueTrail.objective: Learn how water vapor cools and forms clouds in the atmosphere
clueTrail.content: High up in the sky, the water vapor gets cold and turns back into tiny water droplets. These droplets stick to dust particles in the air and form clouds! This process is called condensation - the opposite of evaporation. You can see condensation on a cold glass on a hot day.

clue.name: Silver Cloud
clue.description: A mystical cloud filled with tiny water droplets

steps: Water vapor rises high into the atmosphere
Water vapor cools and condenses around dust particles
Tiny droplets cluster together to form clouds

clueTrail.title: Return to Earth - Precipitation
clueTrail.objective: Discover how water returns to Earth as rain, snow, or hail
clueTrail.content: When the water droplets in clouds get too heavy, they fall back down to Earth! This can happen as rain, snow, sleet, or even hail, depending on how cold it is. This falling water is called precipitation. The water then flows into rivers and oceans, and the cycle starts all over again!

clue.name: Crystal Raindrop
clue.description: A perfect raindrop with Earth's reflection inside

questions.question: What happens when water droplets in clouds become too heavy?
questions.explanation: When water droplets become too heavy to float in the air, gravity pulls them down as precipitation!

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a type of precipitation?
questions.explanation: Evaporation is when water turns to vapor and goes up, not when it comes down as precipitation!

finalChallenge.title: Unlock the Water Cycle Treasure
finalChallenge.description: Use your 3 collected clues to complete the water cycle puzzle!
finalChallenge.instructions: Place each clue in the correct position and complete the cycle by filling in the connecting words.

treasure.name: Master of the Water Cycle
treasure.description: You've discovered how water travels through nature in an endless cycle!
